basics.name: Raul Podar
basics.label: Android Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Android Engineer with over 5 years in the software industry. I am passionate about mentoring, which not only allows me to share knowledge but also deepens my understanding. I excel in taking a systemic approach to problem-solving, driving projects forward with scalable and efficient solutions.

work.name: Sky
work.summary: Entrusted by management to lead and maintain a critical legacy project generating £30 million per quarter. Acted as the Tech Lead, ensuring the project's continued success and stability.
highlights: Owned the release process and incorporated long-overdue automations that saved up to 3 hours for each merge into our config repository.
Mentored three junior members by proactively reviewing their code and guiding them through the project, helping them earn confidence and greater ownership.
Finalized a migration to Mediatailor resulting in approximately £1 million saved annually on fees and enabling live personalized ads for users.
Managed the tech-debt backlog and led tech sessions to share knowledge within the team.
Ensured a smooth transition to ExoPlayer after a complex and time-consuming team effort.

work.name: NiloHealth
work.summary: Worked closely with the Product team to better define the requirements of the Mobile Apps.
highlights: Responsible for releases to AppStore and PlayStore, ensuring no critical bugs are released.
Created an automation script that reduced person-hours by 2 hours for every release (Python).
Developed novel features for Android (Compose and Coroutines) and iOS (Swift UI) that increased content activation by 25% and doubled the number of registrations to roundtable events.
Restructured the data layer of mobile apps using newly introduced design patterns (e.g., Repository).
Contributed to architectural adjustments within the UI layer, resulting in loosely coupled code and reducing critical bugs (UI freezes) by 40%.
Responsible for research, ticket definitions, and development of various features, such as local notifications for both mobile platforms.

work.name: Sky
work.summary: Led the development of a GraphQL middleware for an R&D project to investigate optimizations of API calls.
highlights: Voted by peers as the winner of the Mobile Academy after a training program.
Practiced Agile development within the Sky Go Android team, using TDD and maintaining a feature-based modular application following an MVVM architecture.
Led the UI development of a new Splash Screen in Compose.
Responsible for the development of the CI/CD pipeline in Jenkins as part of an educational project.

work.name: Phlashweb
work.summary: Captured reusable components of a Laravel (PHP) web application and optimized the code.
highlights: Created testing sandboxes and performed several server migrations.
Implemented parts of existing WordPress projects.
Responsible for fixing various visual bugs to improve website responsiveness.

work.name: Queen Mary University of London
work.summary: Assisted with the delivery of practical exercises for level 4 and 5 modules.
highlights: Managed groups of students by guiding them weekly based on a semester-long project (Software Engineering).
Helped with assessments of coursework and provided feedback to students.
Assisted in modules: Software Engineering, Algorithms and Data Structures, Procedural Programming, Computer Systems and Networks, Logic and Discrete Structures, Fundamentals of Web Technology.
